todos.text:
PHASE 0: SETUP & PROTOCOL (READ FIRST)

**Explanations:**
- Set up the Obsidian “Core-7” knowledge system under `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7/` with a master dashboard, seven core notes, and a weekly review note, following the organizer file.
- Idempotent execution: never overwrite blindly; merge and record diffs. Only Markdown+YAML; no binary assets.
- If filename/title/link conflicts occur, generate `conflict_report.md` at the vault root.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Single source of truth: `memory-bank/plan/organize.md`.
- Path is fixed: `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7/`.
- Pure Markdown + YAML only; no binary assets.
- Idempotent merges; produce diff summary for any changes.
- On conflicts (filenames/titles/links), write `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7/conflict_report.md`.

PHASE 1: Scaffold vault directory and README

**Explanations:**
- Create `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7/` if missing and add `README.md` describing the Core-7 system and navigation.
- If files pre-exist, do not overwrite; compare and produce a short diff summary.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Keep directory strictly under `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7/`.
- No destructive writes; merges only with recorded diffs.

PHASE 2: Generate master dashboard note 0_DASHBOARD_Core7.md

**Explanations:**
- Create `0_DASHBOARD_Core7.md` using the organizer’s dashboard structure: YAML frontmatter (title, tags, review), Core Areas list with wiki-links, Dataview snapshot section, and usage notes.
- Ensure links use exact target filenames to avoid broken backlinks.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Preserve Markdown+YAML only; include Dataview code blocks literally.
- Idempotent merge if a dashboard already exists; do not drop existing custom sections.

PHASE 3: Generate seven core notes (1–7) with standardized skeletons

**Explanations:**
- Create:
  - `1_AI_Model_Development&Training.md`
  - `2_Data_Handling&Preprocessing.md`
  - `3_Integration&Deployment.md`
  - `4_Prototyping&Optimization.md`
  - `5_Collaboration&Communication.md`
  - `6_Continuous_Learning&Ethics.md`
  - `7_Freelance&_Client_Work_Handling.md`
- Each note includes sections per organizer: YAML frontmatter (title, tags, review schedule), “Ano Ito”, “Tools/Frameworks”, “Sample Tasks”, “Checklists”, and a backlink to the dashboard.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Keep filenames exactly as listed.
- If a file exists, merge sections—never overwrite; preserve existing content and log diffs.

PHASE 4: Generate Weekly_Review.md with Dataview section and reflection questions

**Explanations:**
- Create `Weekly_Review.md` with YAML frontmatter, a short “Ano Ito”, review flow steps pointing back to the dashboard and cores, reflection questions, and a Dataview table for quick stats.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Dataview code blocks are literal text; ensure code fences are balanced.
- Idempotent merge if the note already exists.

PHASE 5: Wire backlinks and link consistency across notes

**Explanations:**
- Ensure all notes contain a `## Links` section pointing back to `[[0_DASHBOARD_Core7]]`.
- Normalize wiki-links so display text and target filenames align exactly; fix any drift from prescribed names.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- If ambiguous or duplicate link targets are found, add entries to `conflict_report.md` and do not rename files unilaterally.

PHASE 6: Dataview syntax sanity pass (static)

**Explanations:**
- Perform a static review to ensure Dataview code fences are correct and queries reference the intended vault path `obsidian/ai-freelance-core7`.
- This is a text-level check only (no plugin execution).

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Do not change query semantics beyond what the organizer specifies.
- If queries reference non-existent folders/files, record in `conflict_report.md`.

PHASE 7: Git branch, commit, push, and open PR

**Explanations:**
- Create a feature branch (e.g., `feature/obsidian-core7-setup`), commit all new/updated Markdown files with a clear message, push, and open a PR describing the Core-7 setup and idempotency policy.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Do not commit binary files; only Markdown+YAML.
- Include a summary of merges/diffs and any `conflict_report.md` entry in the PR description.

PHASE 8: Idempotency and conflict audit

**Explanations:**
- Re-run a non-destructive pass to confirm that re-applying this plan makes zero unintended changes.
- If conflicts or drifts appear (filenames/titles/links), ensure `conflict_report.md` documents them, and that merges are lossless.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <task_id ReplaceAll>
python3 todo_manager.py done <task_id ReplaceAll> <PHASE_INDEX>
```

IMPORTANT NOTE:
- Completion is valid only if a second pass results in no changes except updated timestamps where appropriate.
- Any unresolved conflicts must block completion of this phase.
